sen.j: 押小路家（おしこうじけ、おしのこうじけ）
sen.e: Oshikoji family (or Oshinokoji family)

sen.j: 藤原北家閑院流の公家。
sen.e: A court noble family of the Kanin line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan.
A court noble family under the Kanin line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan.

sen.j: 堂上家の押小路家（藤原北家閑院流）
sen.e: The Oshikoji family which was Toshoke (the Kanin line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan)
The Oshikoji family had the status of Toshoke (the Kanin line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan)
The Oshikoji family had the status of Toshoke (the Kanin line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan).

sen.j: 押小路家は、羽林家の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: The Oshikoji family was a court noble family with the family rank of Urinke.
The Oshikoji family was a court noble family with the family rank of Urinke.
The Oshikoji family was a court noble family with the family rank of Urinke.

sen.j: 寛文年間（1661年～1673年）、三条西公勝の次男押小路公音が創設した。
sen.e: During 1661 to 1673, the Oshikoji family was founded by Kinoto, the second son of Kimikatsu SANJONISHI.
Between 1661 to 1673, the Oshikoji family was founded by Kinoto, the second son of Kimikatsu SANJONISHI.
Between 1661 to 1673, the Oshikoji family was founded by Kinoto, the second son of Kimikatsu SANJONISHI.

sen.j: 押小路の家名は、居住地名を由来とする。
sen.e: The name 'Oshikoji' was a toponym.
The name 'Oshikoji' was a toponym.
The name 'Oshikoji' was a toponym.
The hereditary stipend was 30 koku.
Their hereditary stipend was thirty koku.
Their hereditary stipend was 130 koku.

sen.j: 家職を歌道とする三条西家の分家だが、漢詩の家柄として知られた。
sen.e: The Oshikoji family branched from the Sanjonishi family; although the hereditary house occupation of the Sanjonishi family was the composition and study of waka poem, the Oshikoji family was famous for its Chinese poetry.

The Oshikoji family was a branch of the Sanjonishi family; although the hereditary business of the Sanjonishi family was the composition and study of waka poetry, the Oshikoji family was famous for their Chinese poetry.

The Oshikoji family was a branch of the Sanjonishi family; although the hereditary business of the Sanjonishi family was the composition and study of waka poetry, the Oshikoji family was famous for their Chinese poetry.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family held the title of viscount.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family held the title of viscount.

tit.j: 地下の押小路家（中原氏）
tit.e: The Oshikoji family which was Jigeke (Nakahara family)
The Oshikoji family was Jigeke (Nakahara family)
The Oshikoji family was Jigeke (Nakahara family).

sen.j: 押小路家は、朝廷に仕えた地下家の官人。
sen.e: The Oshikoji family was Jigeke and a court official family served at the Imperial Court.
The Oshikoji family was Jigeke and a court official family that served the Imperial Court.
The Oshikoji family was Jigeke and a court official family that served the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 室町時代後期から押小路を称した。
sen.e: After the latter half of the Muromachi period, they called themselves 'Oshikoji'.
After the latter half of the Muromachi period, they called themselves 'Oshikoji'.
After the latter half of the Muromachi period, they called themselves 'Oshikoji.'
The family inherited hereditary academic skill of Confucian studies 'Myogyodo'.
The family inherited the hereditary academic skill of Confucian studies 'Myogyodo.'
The family inherited the hereditary academic skill of Confucian studies 'Myogyodo.'

sen.j: 外記（太政官の主典（さかん四等官の4番目））を世襲し、「局務（きょくむ）」とも称された。
sen.e: The family served as Geki, the external secretariat (fourth grade of the four grades of clerks) for generations and called 'Kyokumu'.
The family served as Geki, the external secretariat (fourth grade of the four grades of clerks) for generations and were called 'Kyokumu.'
The family served as Geki, the external secretariat (fourth grade of the four grades of clerks) for generations and were called 'Kyokumu.'

sen.j: 明経博士となるものを輩出し、後には掃部頭（掃部寮の長官（かみ））、造酒正（造酒司の長官（かみ））を兼任した。
sen.e: The family produced Myogyo hakase (scholar), and later, concurrently served as Kamon no Kami (Head of the Bureau of Housekeeping) and Miki no Tsukasa (Head of the Brewery).
The family produced Myogyo hakase (scholar), and later, concurrently served as Kamon no Kami (Head of the Bureau of Housekeeping) and Miki no Tsukasa (Head of the Brewery).
The family produced Myogyo hakase (scholar), and later, concurrently served as Kamon no Kami (Head of the Bureau of Housekeeping) and Miki no Tsukasa (Head of the Brewery).
The hereditary stipend was 54 koku.
Their hereditary stipend was fifty-four koku.
Their hereditary stipend was fifty-four koku.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family held the title of baron.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family held the title of baron.

sen.j: 地下家であったが、江戸時代後期に師資・師徳は従三位に叙された。
sen.e: Although the family was Jigeke, Morosuke and Moronori were bestowed upon Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in the latter half of the Edo period.
Although the family was Jigeke, Morosuke and Moronori were bestowed upon Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) during the latter half of the Edo period.
Although the family was Jigeke, Morosuke and Moronori were bestowed upon Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) during the latter half of the Edo period.

sen.j: 分家に同じく地下家の志水家・山口家がある。
sen.e: From the Oshikoji family, the Shimizu family and the Yamaguchi family, which were Jigeke, were branched.
The Shimizu family and the Yamaguchi family, were Jigeke, and were branches of the Oshikoji family,
